00001 <h2>Instructions</h2>
00002 
00003 <p>
00004         Drop Moments into ~/Library/Widgets (that's the Library folder located in your home folder, preferred) or /Library/Widgets.
00005         Activate Dashboard, drag the widget to your screen and enjoy!
00006 </p>
00007 
00008 <p>
00009         To load a photo in the widget, simply drag a file on it from the Finder or iPhoto, or a web image from Safari or your favorite web browser. Moments will load and display it. To change frame styles, double click the widget. To remove the photo, just hit Backspace.
00010 </p>
00011 
00012 <p>
00013         You can load as many pictures as you like in every instance of the widget. To start a slideshow, hit the space bar, hit it another time to pause. You can move forward and backwards between the pictures using the arrow keys; to delete a picture you no longer want, hit backspace.
00014 </p>
00015 
00016 <p class="centered">
00017         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/moments/moments-back-screenshot-1.0.png"
00018                 alt="Moments Widget back" />
00019 </p>
00020 
00021 <p>
00022         Turn the widget to show its preferences. <b>Size</b> can be chosen between five discrete values: micro, tiny, medium, large and huge; the widget will resize with a nice animation.
00023         If you'd like to remove the glass reflection effect, you can deselect the <b>With Glass</b> checkbox. Slideshow controls only apply when the widget holds more than a photo.
00024         <b>Slideshow interval</b> is the time in seconds after which a photo is changed. <b>Auto Slideshow</b> allows the slideshow to automatically begin once you turn the widget to its front.
00025 </p>
00026 
00027 <div class="comment-odd">
00028         <h4>Tip: how to drag a file onto the widget</h4>
00029         <ol>
00030                 <li>click and drag a photo from Finder, iPhoto, Safari etc.</li>
00031                 <li>bring down Dashboard hitting F12 or using a Desktop Corner <strong>without releasing the mouse button</strong>.</li>
00032                 <li>drag the photo on the widget and release the mouse button.</li>
00033         </ol>
00034 </div>
